body_html:
@fehiepsi I believe this is more of a precision issue. If you try:

>>> A = torch.randn(1000, 1000)
>>> A = A @ A.t()
>>> B = torch.randn(1000, 1)
>>> L = A.potrf(False)
>>> X = B.potrs(L, False)
>>> print("potrs error: ", torch.dist(A @ X, B))
potrs error:  0.06259258091449738

, it gives expected results. Same goes for trtrs :)

body:
@fehiepsi I believe this is more of a precision issue. If you try:
```
>>> A = torch.randn(1000, 1000)
>>> A = A @ A.t()
>>> B = torch.randn(1000, 1)
>>> L = A.potrf(False)
>>> X = B.potrs(L, False)
>>> print("potrs error: ", torch.dist(A @ X, B))
potrs error:  0.06259258091449738
```
, it gives expected results. Same goes for trtrs :)
